cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest toward the North Carolina coast tonight, then expected to curve north to north-northeast across eastern NC, southeastern VA, the Delmarva Peninsula and toward southern New Jersey/New York late Saturday through Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina (near Surf City–Ocracoke Inlet)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect north of Fenwick Island, DE at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from Cape Fear, NC to Fenwick Island, DE; storm-surge warnings Bogue Inlet NC to Chincoteague VA and south Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Surf City, NC northward through the Delmarva Peninsula, lower Delaware Bay, and as far north as Manasquan Inlet, NJ (1–3 ft surge possible)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Sunday with sustained winds 20–30 mph and gusts 35–40 mph (low chance of reaching tropical-storm force)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible along the lower New York–New Jersey Bight at times of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches expected Saturday night through Monday with localized urban and poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf through the weekend; isolated tornado risk remains well south of the port
